content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of wine, theater, and revelry?

In Greek mythology, the god of wine, theater, and revelry was Dionysus. He was also associated with fertility, ritual madness, and religious ecstasy. Dionysus was one of the twelve Olympians and was the son of Zeus and Semele. He was often depicted wearing a crown of vine leaves and carrying a thyrsus, a staff entwined with ivy and topped with a pine cone. His festivals were known for their ecstatic and sometimes chaotic nature, reflecting his dual nature as both a joyful and a dangerous deity.
